013package org.apache.juneau;
014
015import static java.util.Arrays.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.ClassMeta.ClassCategory.*;
017import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.ThrowableUtils.*;
018import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
019import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.*;
020import static org.apache.juneau.internal.CollectionUtils.map;
021import static org.apache.juneau.internal.ConsumerUtils.*;
022
023import java.io.*;
024import java.lang.annotation.*;
025import java.lang.reflect.*;
026import java.lang.reflect.Proxy;
027import java.net.*;
028import java.time.temporal.*;
029import java.util.*;
030import java.util.concurrent.*;
031import java.util.function.*;
032
033import org.apache.juneau.annotation.*;
034import org.apache.juneau.common.utils.*;
035import org.apache.juneau.cp.*;
036import org.apache.juneau.internal.*;
037import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
038import org.apache.juneau.reflect.*;
039import org.apache.juneau.swap.*;
040
041/**
042 * A wrapper class around the {@link Class} object that provides cached information about that class.
043 *
044 * <p>
045 * Instances of this class can be created through the {@link BeanContext#getClassMeta(Class)} method.
046 *
047 * <p>
048 * The {@link BeanContext} class will cache and reuse instances of this class except for the following class types:
049 * <ul>
050 *    <li>Arrays
051 *    <li>Maps with non-Object key/values.
052 *    <li>Collections with non-Object key/values.
053 * </ul>
054 *
055 * <p>
056 * This class is tied to the {@link BeanContext} class because it's that class that makes the determination of what is
057 * a bean.
058 *
059 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
060
061 * </ul>
062 *
063 * @param <T> The class type of the wrapped class.
064 */
065@Bean(properties="innerClass,classCategory,elementType,keyType,valueType,notABeanReason,initException,beanMeta")
066public class ClassMeta<T> implements Type {
067
068   /** Class categories. */
069   enum ClassCategory {
070      MAP, COLLECTION, CLASS, METHOD, NUMBER, DECIMAL, BOOLEAN, CHAR, DATE, ARRAY, ENUM, OTHER, CHARSEQ, STR, OBJ, URI, BEANMAP, READER, INPUTSTREAM, VOID, ARGS, OPTIONAL
071   }
072
073   final Class<T> innerClass;                              // The class being wrapped.
074   final ClassInfo info;
075
076   private final Class<? extends T> implClass;             // The implementation class to use if this is an interface.
077   private final ClassCategory cc;                         // The class category.
078   private final Method fromStringMethod;                  // The static valueOf(String) or fromString(String) or forString(String) method (if it has one).
079   private final ConstructorInfo
080      noArgConstructor,                                    // The no-arg constructor for this class (if it has one).
081      stringConstructor;                                   // The X(String) constructor (if it has one).
082   private final Method
083      exampleMethod;                                       // The example() or @Example-annotated method (if it has one).
084   private final Field
085      exampleField;                                        // The @Example-annotated field (if it has one).
086   private final Setter
087      namePropertyMethod,                                  // The method to set the name on an object (if it has one).
088      parentPropertyMethod;                                // The method to set the parent on an object (if it has one).
089   private final boolean
090      isDelegate,                                          // True if this class extends Delegate.
091      isAbstract,                                          // True if this class is abstract.
092      isMemberClass;                                       // True if this is a non-static member class.
093   private final Object primitiveDefault;                  // Default value for primitive type classes.
094   private final Map<String,Method>
095      publicMethods;                                       // All public methods, including static methods.
096   private final ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps;              // Any ObjectSwaps where the normal type is a subclass of this class.
097   private final ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>,ObjectSwap<?,?>>
098      childSwapMap,                                        // Maps normal subclasses to ObjectSwaps.
099      childUnswapMap;                                      // Maps swap subclasses to ObjectSwaps.
100   private final ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps;                     // The object POJO swaps associated with this bean (if it has any).
101   private final BuilderSwap<T,?> builderSwap;             // The builder swap associated with this bean (if it has one).
102   private final BeanContext beanContext;                  // The bean context that created this object.
103   private final ClassMeta<?>
104      elementType,                                         // If ARRAY or COLLECTION, the element class type.
105      keyType,                                             // If MAP, the key class type.
106      valueType;                                           // If MAP, the value class type.
107   private final BeanMeta<T> beanMeta;                     // The bean meta for this bean class (if it's a bean).
108   private final String
109      typePropertyName,                                    // The property name of the _type property for this class and subclasses.
110      notABeanReason,                                      // If this isn't a bean, the reason why.
111      dictionaryName;                                      // The dictionary name of this class if it has one.
112   private final Throwable initException;                  // Any exceptions thrown in the init() method.
113   private final InvocationHandler invocationHandler;      // The invocation handler for this class (if it has one).
114   private final BeanRegistry beanRegistry;                // The bean registry of this class meta (if it has one).
115   private final ClassMeta<?>[] args;                      // Arg types if this is an array of args.
116   private final String example;                           // Example JSON.
117   private final Map<Class<?>,Mutater<?,T>> fromMutaters = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
118   private final Map<Class<?>,Mutater<T,?>> toMutaters = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
119   private final Mutater<String,T> stringMutater;
120   private final Map<Class<?>,Annotation[]> annotationArrayMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
121   private final Map<Class<?>,Optional<?>> annotationLastMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
122   private final Map<String,Optional<?>> properties = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
123   private final BiMap<Object,String> enumValues;
124
125   private final SimpleReadWriteLock lock = new SimpleReadWriteLock(false);
126
127   /**
128    * Construct a new {@code ClassMeta} based on the specified {@link Class}.
129    *
130    * @param innerClass The class being wrapped.
131    * @param beanContext The bean context that created this object.
132    * @param implClass
133    *    For interfaces and abstract classes, this represents the "real" class to instantiate.
134    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
135    * @param swaps
136    *    The {@link ObjectSwap} programmatically associated with this class.
137    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
138    * @param childSwaps
139    *    The child {@link ObjectSwap ObjectSwaps} programmatically associated with this class.
140    *    These are the <c>ObjectSwaps</c> that have normal classes that are subclasses of this class.
141    *    Can be <jk>null</jk>.
142    * @param delayedInit
143    *    Don't call init() in constructor.
144    *    Used for delayed initialization when the possibility of class reference loops exist.
145    */
146   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
147   ClassMeta(Class<T> innerClass, BeanContext beanContext, ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps, ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps) {
148      this.innerClass = innerClass;
149      this.info = ClassInfo.of(innerClass);
150      this.beanContext = beanContext;
151      String notABeanReason = null;
152
153      try (SimpleLock x = lock.write()) {
154         // We always immediately add this class meta to the bean context cache so that we can resolve recursive references.
155         if (beanContext != null && beanContext.cmCache != null && isCacheable(innerClass))
156            beanContext.cmCache.put(innerClass, this);
157
158         ClassMetaBuilder<T> builder = new ClassMetaBuilder(innerClass, beanContext, swaps, childSwaps);
159
160         this.cc = builder.cc;
161         this.isDelegate = builder.isDelegate;
162         this.fromStringMethod = builder.fromStringMethod;
163         this.parentPropertyMethod = builder.parentPropertyMethod;
164         this.namePropertyMethod = builder.namePropertyMethod;
165         this.noArgConstructor = builder.noArgConstructor;
166         this.stringConstructor = builder.stringConstructor;
167         this.primitiveDefault = builder.primitiveDefault;
168         this.publicMethods = builder.publicMethods;
169         this.swaps = builder.swaps.isEmpty() ? null : builder.swaps.toArray(new ObjectSwap[builder.swaps.size()]);
170         this.builderSwap = builder.builderSwap;
171         this.keyType = builder.keyType;
172         this.valueType = builder.valueType;
173         this.elementType = builder.elementType;
174         notABeanReason = builder.notABeanReason;
175         this.beanMeta = builder.beanMeta;
176         this.initException = builder.initException;
177         this.typePropertyName = builder.typePropertyName;
178         this.dictionaryName = builder.dictionaryName;
179         this.invocationHandler = builder.invocationHandler;
180         this.beanRegistry = builder.beanRegistry;
181         this.isMemberClass = builder.isMemberClass;
182         this.isAbstract = builder.isAbstract;
183         this.implClass = builder.implClass;
184         this.childUnswapMap = builder.childUnswapMap;
185         this.childSwapMap = builder.childSwapMap;
186         this.childSwaps = builder.childSwaps;
187         this.exampleMethod = builder.exampleMethod;
188         this.exampleField = builder.exampleField;
189         this.example = builder.example;
190         this.args = null;
191         this.stringMutater = builder.stringMutater;
192         this.enumValues = builder.enumValues == null ? null : builder.enumValues.build();
193      } catch (ClassMetaRuntimeException e) {
194         notABeanReason = e.getMessage();
195         throw e;
196      } finally {
197         this.notABeanReason = notABeanReason;
198      }
199   }
200
201   /**
202    * Generated classes shouldn't be cacheable to prevent needlessly filling up the cache.
203    */
204   private static boolean isCacheable(Class<?> c) {
205      String n = c.getName();
206      char x = n.charAt(n.length()-1);  // All generated classes appear to end with digits.
207      if (x >= '0' && x <= '9') {
208         if (n.indexOf("$$") != -1 || n.startsWith("sun") || n.startsWith("com.sun") || n.indexOf("$Proxy") != -1)
209            return false;
210      }
211      return true;
212   }
213
214   /**
215    * Causes thread to wait until constructor has exited.
216    */
217   void waitForInit() {
218      try (SimpleLock x = lock.read()) {}
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Copy constructor.
223    *
224    * <p>
225    * Used for creating Map and Collection class metas that shouldn't be cached.
226    */
227   ClassMeta(ClassMeta<T> mainType, ClassMeta<?> keyType, ClassMeta<?> valueType, ClassMeta<?> elementType) {
228      this.innerClass = mainType.innerClass;
229      this.info = mainType.info;
230      this.implClass = mainType.implClass;
231      this.childSwaps = mainType.childSwaps;
232      this.childSwapMap = mainType.childSwapMap;
233      this.childUnswapMap = mainType.childUnswapMap;
234      this.cc = mainType.cc;
235      this.fromStringMethod = mainType.fromStringMethod;
236      this.noArgConstructor = mainType.noArgConstructor;
237      this.stringConstructor = mainType.stringConstructor;
238      this.namePropertyMethod = mainType.namePropertyMethod;
239      this.parentPropertyMethod = mainType.parentPropertyMethod;
240      this.isDelegate = mainType.isDelegate;
241      this.isAbstract = mainType.isAbstract;
242      this.isMemberClass = mainType.isMemberClass;
243      this.primitiveDefault = mainType.primitiveDefault;
244      this.publicMethods = mainType.publicMethods;
245      this.beanContext = mainType.beanContext;
246      this.elementType = elementType;
247      this.keyType = keyType;
248      this.valueType = valueType;
249      this.invocationHandler = mainType.invocationHandler;
250      this.beanMeta = mainType.beanMeta;
251      this.typePropertyName = mainType.typePropertyName;
252      this.dictionaryName = mainType.dictionaryName;
253      this.notABeanReason = mainType.notABeanReason;
254      this.swaps = mainType.swaps;
255      this.builderSwap = mainType.builderSwap;
256      this.initException = mainType.initException;
257      this.beanRegistry = mainType.beanRegistry;
258      this.exampleMethod = mainType.exampleMethod;
259      this.exampleField = mainType.exampleField;
260      this.example = mainType.example;
261      this.args = null;
262      this.stringMutater = mainType.stringMutater;
263      this.enumValues = mainType.enumValues;
264   }
265
266   /**
267    * Constructor for args-arrays.
268    */
269   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
270   ClassMeta(ClassMeta<?>[] args) {
271      this.innerClass = (Class<T>) Object[].class;
272      this.info = ClassInfo.of(innerClass);
273      this.args = args;
274      this.implClass = null;
275      this.childSwaps = null;
276      this.childSwapMap = null;
277      this.childUnswapMap = null;
278      this.cc = ARGS;
279      this.fromStringMethod = null;
280      this.noArgConstructor = null;
281      this.stringConstructor = null;
282      this.namePropertyMethod = null;
283      this.parentPropertyMethod = null;
284      this.isDelegate = false;
285      this.isAbstract = false;
286      this.isMemberClass = false;
287      this.primitiveDefault = null;
288      this.publicMethods = null;
289      this.beanContext = null;
290      this.elementType = null;
291      this.keyType = null;
292      this.valueType = null;
293      this.invocationHandler = null;
294      this.beanMeta = null;
295      this.typePropertyName = null;
296      this.dictionaryName = null;
297      this.notABeanReason = null;
298      this.swaps = null;
299      this.builderSwap = null;
300      this.initException = null;
301      this.beanRegistry = null;
302      this.exampleMethod = null;
303      this.exampleField = null;
304      this.example = null;
305      this.stringMutater = null;
306      this.enumValues = null;
307   }
308
309   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes","hiding"})
310   private class ClassMetaBuilder<T> {
311      Class<T> innerClass;
312      ClassInfo ci;
313      Class<? extends T> implClass;
314      BeanContext beanContext;
315      ClassCategory cc = ClassCategory.OTHER;
316      boolean
317         isDelegate = false,
318         isMemberClass = false,
319         isAbstract = false;
320      Method
321         fromStringMethod = null;
322      Setter
323         parentPropertyMethod = null,
324         namePropertyMethod = null;
325      ConstructorInfo
326         noArgConstructor = null,
327         stringConstructor = null;
328      Object primitiveDefault = null;
329      Map<String,Method>
330         publicMethods = map();
331      ClassMeta<?>
332         keyType = null,
333         valueType = null,
334         elementType = null;
335      String
336         typePropertyName = null,
337         notABeanReason = null,
338         dictionaryName = null;
339      Throwable initException = null;
340      BeanMeta beanMeta = null;
341      List<ObjectSwap> swaps = list();
342      BuilderSwap builderSwap;
343      InvocationHandler invocationHandler = null;
344      BeanRegistry beanRegistry = null;
345      ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps;
346      ConcurrentHashMap<Class<?>,ObjectSwap<?,?>>
347         childSwapMap,
348         childUnswapMap;
349      Method exampleMethod;
350      Field exampleField;
351      String example;
352      Mutater<String,T> stringMutater;
353      BiMap.Builder<Object,String> enumValues;
354
355      ClassMetaBuilder(Class<T> innerClass, BeanContext beanContext, ObjectSwap<T,?>[] swaps, ObjectSwap<?,?>[] childSwaps) {
356         this.innerClass = innerClass;
357         this.beanContext = beanContext;
358         BeanContext bc = beanContext;
359
360         this.childSwaps = childSwaps;
361         if (childSwaps == null) {
362            this.childSwapMap = null;
363            this.childUnswapMap = null;
364         } else {
365            this.childSwapMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
366            this.childUnswapMap = new ConcurrentHashMap<>();
367         }
368
369         Class<T> c = innerClass;
370         ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
371
372         if (c.isPrimitive()) {
373            if (c == Boolean.TYPE)
374               cc = BOOLEAN;
375            else if (c == Byte.TYPE || c == Short.TYPE || c == Integer.TYPE || c == Long.TYPE || c == Float.TYPE || c == Double.TYPE) {
376               if (c == Float.TYPE || c == Double.TYPE)
377                  cc = DECIMAL;
378               else
379                  cc = NUMBER;
380            }
381            else if (c == Character.TYPE)
382               cc = CHAR;
383            else if (c == void.class || c == Void.class)
384               cc = VOID;
385         } else {
386            if (ci.isChildOf(Delegate.class))
387               isDelegate = true;
388
389            if (c == Object.class)
390               cc = OBJ;
391            else if (c.isEnum())
392               cc = ENUM;
393            else if (c.equals(Class.class))
394               cc = ClassCategory.CLASS;
395            else if (ci.isChildOf(Method.class))
396               cc = METHOD;
397            else if (ci.isChildOf(CharSequence.class)) {
398               if (c.equals(String.class))
399                  cc = STR;
400               else
401                  cc = CHARSEQ;
402            }
403            else if (ci.isChildOf(Number.class)) {
404               if (ci.isChildOfAny(Float.class, Double.class))
405                  cc = DECIMAL;
406               else
407                  cc = NUMBER;
408            }
409            else if (ci.isChildOf(Collection.class))
410               cc = COLLECTION;
411            else if (ci.isChildOf(Map.class)) {
412               if (ci.isChildOf(BeanMap.class))
413                  cc = BEANMAP;
414               else
415                  cc = MAP;
416            }
417            else if (c == Character.class)
418               cc = CHAR;
419            else if (c == Boolean.class)
420               cc = BOOLEAN;
421            else if (ci.isChildOfAny(Date.class, Calendar.class))
422               cc = DATE;
423            else if (c.isArray())
424               cc = ARRAY;
425            else if (ci.isChildOfAny(URL.class, URI.class) || ci.hasAnnotation(bc, Uri.class))
426               cc = URI;
427            else if (ci.isChildOf(Reader.class))
428               cc = READER;
429            else if (ci.isChildOf(InputStream.class))
430               cc = INPUTSTREAM;
431            else if (ci.is(Optional.class))
432               cc = OPTIONAL;
433         }
434
435         isMemberClass = ci.isMemberClass() && ci.isNotStatic();
436
437         // Find static fromString(String) or equivalent method.
438         // fromString() must be checked before valueOf() so that Enum classes can create their own
439         //    specialized fromString() methods to override the behavior of Enum.valueOf(String).
440         // valueOf() is used by enums.
441         // parse() is used by the java logging Level class.
442         // forName() is used by Class and Charset
443         String[] fromStringMethodNames = {"fromString","fromValue","valueOf","parse","parseString","forName","forString"};
444         fromStringMethod = Utils.opt(ci.getPublicMethod(
445         x -> x.isStatic()
446         && x.isNotDeprecated()
447         && x.hasReturnType(c)
448         && x.hasParamTypes(String.class)
449         && ArrayUtils.contains(x.getName(), fromStringMethodNames))).map(MethodInfo::inner)
450            .orElse(null);
451
452         // Find example() method if present.
453         exampleMethod = Utils.opt(ci.getPublicMethod(
454         x -> x.isStatic()
455         && x.isNotDeprecated()
456         && x.hasName("example")
457         && x.hasFuzzyParamTypes(BeanSession.class))).map(MethodInfo::inner)
458            .orElse(null);
459
460         ci.forEachAllField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, ParentProperty.class), x -> {
461            if (x.isStatic())
462               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@ParentProperty used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static.", x);
463            parentPropertyMethod = new Setter.FieldSetter(x.accessible().inner());
464         });
465
466         ci.forEachAllField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, NameProperty.class), x -> {
467            if (x.isStatic())
468               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@NameProperty used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static.", x);
469            namePropertyMethod = new Setter.FieldSetter(x.accessible().inner());
470         });
471
472         ci.forEachDeclaredField(x -> x.hasAnnotation(bc, Example.class), x -> {
473            if (! (x.isStatic() && ci.isParentOf(x.getType().inner())))
474               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@Example used on invalid field ''{0}''.  Must be static and an instance of the type.", x);
475            exampleField = x.accessible().inner();
476         });
477
478         // Find @NameProperty and @ParentProperty methods if present.
479         List<MethodInfo> methods = ci.getMethods();
480         for (int i = methods.size()-1; i >=0; i--) {
481            MethodInfo m = methods.get(i);
482            if (m.hasAnnotation(bc, ParentProperty.class)) {
483               if (m.isStatic() || ! m.hasNumParams(1))
484                  throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@ParentProperty used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must not be static and have one argument.", m);
485               m.setAccessible();
486               parentPropertyMethod = new Setter.MethodSetter(m.inner());
487            }
488            if (m.hasAnnotation(bc, NameProperty.class)) {
489               if (m.isStatic() || ! m.hasNumParams(1))
490                  throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@NameProperty used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must not be static and have one argument.", m);
491               m.setAccessible();
492               namePropertyMethod = new Setter.MethodSetter(m.inner());
493            }
494         }
495
496         ci.forEachDeclaredMethod(m -> m.hasAnnotation(bc, Example.class), m -> {
497            if (! (m.isStatic() && m.hasFuzzyParamTypes(BeanSession.class) && ci.isParentOf(m.getReturnType().inner())))
498               throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "@Example used on invalid method ''{0}''.  Must be static and return an instance of the declaring class.", m.toString());
499            m.setAccessible();
500            exampleMethod = m.inner();
501         });
502
503         // Note:  Primitive types are normally abstract.
504         isAbstract = ci.isAbstract() && ci.isNotPrimitive();
505
506         // Find constructor(String) method if present.
507         ci.forEachPublicConstructor(cs -> cs.isPublic() && cs.isNotDeprecated(), cs -> {
508            List<ClassInfo> pt = cs.getParamTypes();
509            if (pt.size() == (isMemberClass ? 1 : 0) && c != Object.class && ! isAbstract) {
510               noArgConstructor = cs;
511            } else if (pt.size() == (isMemberClass ? 2 : 1)) {
512               ClassInfo arg = pt.get(isMemberClass ? 1 : 0);
513               if (arg.is(String.class))
514                  stringConstructor = cs;
515            }
516         });
517
518         primitiveDefault = ci.getPrimitiveDefault();
519
520         ci.forEachPublicMethod(
521            MethodInfo::isNotDeprecated,
522            x -> publicMethods.put(x.getSignature(), x.inner())
523         );
524
525         BeanFilter beanFilter = findBeanFilter(bc);
526         MarshalledFilter marshalledFilter = findMarshalledFilter(bc);
527
528         addAll(this.swaps, swaps);
529
530         if (bc != null)
531            this.builderSwap = BuilderSwap.findSwapFromObjectClass(bc, c, bc.getBeanConstructorVisibility(), bc.getBeanMethodVisibility());
532
533         findSwaps(this.swaps, bc);
534
535         if (beanFilter != null) {
536            example = beanFilter.getExample();
537            implClass = (Class<? extends T>) beanFilter.getImplClass();
538         }
539
540         if (marshalledFilter != null) {
541            if (example == null)
542               example = marshalledFilter.getExample();
543            if (implClass == null)
544               implClass = (Class<? extends T>) marshalledFilter.getImplClass();
545         }
546
547         if (innerClass != Object.class) {
548            ClassInfo x = implClass == null ? ci : ClassInfo.of(implClass);
549            noArgConstructor = x.getPublicConstructor(ConstructorInfo::hasNoParams);
550         }
551
552         try {
553
554            // If this is an array, get the element type.
555            if (cc == ARRAY)
556               elementType = findClassMeta(innerClass.getComponentType());
557
558            // If this is a MAP, see if it's parameterized (e.g. AddressBook extends HashMap<String,Person>)
559            else if (cc == MAP) {
560               ClassMeta[] parameters = findParameters();
561               if (parameters != null && parameters.length == 2) {
562                  keyType = parameters[0];
563                  valueType = parameters[1];
564               } else {
565                  keyType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
566                  valueType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
567               }
568            }
569
570            // If this is a COLLECTION, see if it's parameterized (e.g. AddressBook extends LinkedList<Person>)
571            else if (cc == COLLECTION || cc == OPTIONAL) {
572               ClassMeta[] parameters = findParameters();
573               if (parameters != null && parameters.length == 1) {
574                  elementType = parameters[0];
575               } else {
576                  elementType = findClassMeta(Object.class);
577               }
578            }
579
580            // If the category is unknown, see if it's a bean.
581            // Note that this needs to be done after all other initialization has been done.
582            else if (cc == OTHER) {
583
584               BeanMeta newMeta = null;
585               try {
586                  newMeta = new BeanMeta(ClassMeta.this, bc, beanFilter, null, implClass == null ? null : noArgConstructor);
587                  notABeanReason = newMeta.notABeanReason;
588
589                  // Always get these even if it's not a bean:
590                  beanRegistry = newMeta.beanRegistry;
591                  typePropertyName = newMeta.typePropertyName;
592
593               } catch (RuntimeException e) {
594                  notABeanReason = e.getMessage();
595                  throw e;
596               }
597               if (notABeanReason == null)
598                  beanMeta = newMeta;
599            }
600
601         } catch (NoClassDefFoundError e) {
602            initException = e;
603         } catch (RuntimeException e) {
604            initException = e;
605            throw e;
606         }
607
608         if (beanMeta != null)
609            dictionaryName = beanMeta.getDictionaryName();
610
611         if (beanMeta != null && bc != null && bc.isUseInterfaceProxies() && innerClass.isInterface())
612            invocationHandler = new BeanProxyInvocationHandler<T>(beanMeta);
613
614         if (bc != null) {
615            bc.forEachAnnotation(Bean.class, c, x -> true, x -> {
616               if (x.dictionary().length != 0)
617                  beanRegistry = new BeanRegistry(bc, null, x.dictionary());
618               // This could be a non-bean POJO with a type name.
619               if (dictionaryName == null && ! x.typeName().isEmpty())
620                  dictionaryName = x.typeName();
621            });
622         }
623
624         if (example == null && bc != null) {
625            bc.forEachAnnotation(Example.class, c, x -> ! x.value().isEmpty(), x -> example = x.value());
626         }
627
628         if (example == null) {
629            switch(cc) {
630               case BOOLEAN:
631                  example = "true";
632                  break;
633               case CHAR:
634                  example = "a";
635                  break;
636               case CHARSEQ:
637               case STR:
638                  example = "foo";
639                  break;
640               case DECIMAL:
641                  if (isFloat())
642                     example = "1.0";
643                  else if (isDouble())
644                     example = "1.0";
645                  break;
646               case ENUM:
647                  Iterator<? extends Enum> i = EnumSet.allOf((Class<? extends Enum>)c).iterator();
648                  if (i.hasNext())
649                     example = beanContext.isUseEnumNames() ? i.next().name() : i.next().toString();
650                  break;
651               case NUMBER:
652                  if (isShort())
653                     example = "1";
654                  else if (isInteger())
655                     example = "1";
656                  else if (isLong())
657                     example = "1";
658                  break;
659               case URI:
660               case ARGS:
661               case ARRAY:
662               case BEANMAP:
663               case CLASS:
664               case COLLECTION:
665               case DATE:
666               case INPUTSTREAM:
667               case MAP:
668               case METHOD:
669               case OBJ:
670               case OTHER:
671               case READER:
672               case OPTIONAL:
673               case VOID:
674                  break;
675            }
676         }
677
678         this.stringMutater = Mutaters.get(String.class, c);
679
680         if (cc == ENUM) {
681            Class<? extends Enum> ec = (Class<? extends Enum<?>>)c;
682            boolean useEnumNames = bc != null && bc.isUseEnumNames();
683            enumValues = BiMap.create();
684            enumValues.unmodifiable();
685            stream(ec.getEnumConstants()).forEach(x -> enumValues.add(x, useEnumNames ? x.name() : x.toString()));
686         }
687      }
688
689      private BeanFilter findBeanFilter(BeanContext bc) {
690         try {
691            List<Bean> ba = info.getAnnotations(bc, Bean.class);
692            if (! ba.isEmpty())
693               return BeanFilter.create(innerClass).applyAnnotations(ba).build();
694         } catch (Exception e) {
695            throw asRuntimeException(e);
696         }
697         return null;
698      }
699
700      private MarshalledFilter findMarshalledFilter(BeanContext bc) {
701         try {
702            List<Marshalled> ba = info.getAnnotations(bc, Marshalled.class);
703            if (! ba.isEmpty())
704               return MarshalledFilter.create(innerClass).applyAnnotations(ba).build();
705         } catch (Exception e) {
706            throw asRuntimeException(e);
707         }
708         return null;
709      }
710
711      private void findSwaps(List<ObjectSwap> l, BeanContext bc) {
712
713         if (bc != null)
714            bc.forEachAnnotation(Swap.class, innerClass, x -> true, x -> l.add(createSwap(x)));
715
716         ObjectSwap defaultSwap = DefaultSwaps.find(ci);
717         if (defaultSwap == null)
718            defaultSwap = AutoObjectSwap.find(bc, ci);
719         if (defaultSwap == null)
720            defaultSwap = AutoNumberSwap.find(bc, ci);
721         if (defaultSwap == null)
722            defaultSwap = AutoMapSwap.find(bc, ci);
723         if (defaultSwap == null)
724            defaultSwap = AutoListSwap.find(bc, ci);
725         if (defaultSwap != null)
726            l.add(defaultSwap);
727      }
728
729      private ObjectSwap<T,?> createSwap(Swap s) {
730         Class<?> c = s.value();
731         if (ClassUtils.isVoid(c))
732            c = s.impl();
733         ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
734
735         if (ci.isChildOf(ObjectSwap.class)) {
736            ObjectSwap ps = BeanCreator.of(ObjectSwap.class).type(c).run();
737            if (s.mediaTypes().length > 0)
738               ps.forMediaTypes(MediaType.ofAll(s.mediaTypes()));
739            if (! s.template().isEmpty())
740               ps.withTemplate(s.template());
741            return ps;
742         }
743
744         if (ci.isChildOf(Surrogate.class)) {
745            List<SurrogateSwap<?,?>> l = SurrogateSwap.findObjectSwaps(c, beanContext);
746            if (! l.isEmpty())
747               return (ObjectSwap<T,?>)l.iterator().next();
748         }
749
750         throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(c, "Invalid swap class ''{0}'' specified.  Must extend from ObjectSwap or Surrogate.", c);
751      }
752
753      private ClassMeta<?> findClassMeta(Class<?> c) {
754         return beanContext.getClassMeta(c, false);
755      }
756
757      private ClassMeta<?>[] findParameters() {
758         return beanContext.findParameters(innerClass, innerClass);
759      }
760   }
761
762   /**
763    * Returns the {@link ClassInfo} wrapper for the underlying class.
764    *
765    * @return The {@link ClassInfo} wrapper for the underlying class, never <jk>null</jk>.
766    */
767   public ClassInfo getInfo() {
768      return info;
769   }

775    * If <jk>null</jk>, <js>"_type"</js> should be assumed.
776    *
777    * @return
778    *    The type property name associated with this bean class, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no explicit type
779    *    property name defined or this isn't a bean.
780    */
781   public String getBeanTypePropertyName() {
782      return typePropertyName;

791    * @return
792    *    The type name associated with this bean class, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no type name defined or this
793    *    isn't a bean.
794    */
795   public String getDictionaryName() {
796      return dictionaryName;
797   }

799   /**

801    *
802    * <p>
803    * This bean registry contains names specified in the {@link Bean#dictionary() @Bean(dictionary)} annotation
804    * defined on the class, regardless of whether the class is an actual bean.
805    * This allows interfaces to define subclasses with type names.
806    *
807    * @return The bean registry for this class, or <jk>null</jk> if no bean registry is associated with it.
808    */
809   public BeanRegistry getBeanRegistry() {
810      return beanRegistry;
811   }

819      return cc;

822   /**
823    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a superclass of or the same as the specified class.
824    *
825    * @param c The comparison class.
826    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a superclass of or the same as the specified class.
827    */
828   public boolean isAssignableFrom(Class<?> c) {
829      return info.isChildOf(c);
830   }
831
832   /**
833    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class is a subclass of or the same as the specified class.
834    *
835    * @param c The comparison class.
836    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class is a subclass of or the same as the specified class.
837    */
838   public boolean isInstanceOf(Class<?> c) {
839      return info.isParentOf(c);

841
842   /**
843    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class or any child classes has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
844    *
845    * <p>
846    * Used when transforming bean properties to prevent having to look up transforms if we know for certain that no
847    * transforms are associated with a bean property.
848    *
849    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class or any child classes has a {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
850    */
851   protected boolean hasChildSwaps() {
852      return childSwaps != null;
853   }
854
855   /**
856    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} where the specified class is the same/subclass of the normal class of one of the
857    * child POJO swaps associated with this class.
858    *
859    * @param normalClass The normal class being resolved.
860    * @return The resolved {@link ObjectSwap} or <jk>null</jk> if none were found.
861    */
862   protected ObjectSwap<?,?> getChildObjectSwapForSwap(Class<?> normalClass) {
863      if (childSwapMap != null) {
864         ObjectSwap<?,?> s = childSwapMap.get(normalClass);
865         if (s == null) {
866            for (ObjectSwap<?,?> f : childSwaps)
867               if (s == null && f.getNormalClass().isParentOf(normalClass))
868                  s = f;
869            if (s == null)
870               s = ObjectSwap.NULL;
871            ObjectSwap<?,?> s2 = childSwapMap.putIfAbsent(normalClass, s);
872            if (s2 != null)
873               s = s2;
874         }
875         if (s == ObjectSwap.NULL)
876            return null;
877         return s;
878      }
879      return null;
880   }
881
882   /**
883    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} where the specified class is the same/subclass of the swap class of one of the child
884    * POJO swaps associated with this class.
885    *
886    * @param swapClass The swap class being resolved.
887    * @return The resolved {@link ObjectSwap} or <jk>null</jk> if none were found.
888    */
889   protected ObjectSwap<?,?> getChildObjectSwapForUnswap(Class<?> swapClass) {
890      if (childUnswapMap != null) {
891         ObjectSwap<?,?> s = childUnswapMap.get(swapClass);
892         if (s == null) {
893            for (ObjectSwap<?,?> f : childSwaps)
894               if (s == null && f.getSwapClass().isParentOf(swapClass))
895                  s = f;
896            if (s == null)
897               s = ObjectSwap.NULL;
898            ObjectSwap<?,?> s2 = childUnswapMap.putIfAbsent(swapClass, s);
899            if (s2 != null)
900               s = s2;
901         }
902         if (s == ObjectSwap.NULL)
903            return null;
904         return s;
905      }
906      return null;
907   }
908
909   /**
910    * Locates the no-arg constructor for the specified class.
911    *
912    * <p>
913    * Constructor must match the visibility requirements specified by parameter 'v'.
914    * If class is abstract, always returns <jk>null</jk>.
915    * Note that this also returns the 1-arg constructor for non-static member classes.
916    *
917    * @param <T> The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
918    * @param c The class from which to locate the no-arg constructor.
919    * @param v The minimum visibility.
920    * @return The constructor, or <jk>null</jk> if no no-arg constructor exists with the required visibility.
921    */
922   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
923   protected static <T> Constructor<? extends T> findNoArgConstructor(Class<?> c, Visibility v) {
924      ClassInfo ci = ClassInfo.of(c);
925      if (ci.isAbstract())
926         return null;
927      boolean isMemberClass = ci.isMemberClass() && ci.isNotStatic();
928      ConstructorInfo cc = ci.getPublicConstructor(
929         x -> x.isVisible(v)
930         && x.isNotDeprecated()
931         && x.hasNumParams(isMemberClass ? 1 : 0)
932      );
933      if (cc != null)
934         return (Constructor<? extends T>) v.transform(cc.inner());
935      return null;
936   }
937
938   /**
939    * Returns the {@link Class} object that this class type wraps.
940    *
941    * @return The wrapped class object.
942    */
943   public Class<T> getInnerClass() {
944      return innerClass;
945   }
946
947   /**
948    * Returns the serialized (swapped) form of this class if there is an {@link ObjectSwap} associated with it.
949    *
950    * @param session
951    *    The bean session.
952    *    <br>Required because the swap used may depend on the media type being serialized or parsed.
953    * @return The serialized class type, or this object if no swap is associated with the class.
954    */
955   public ClassMeta<?> getSerializedClassMeta(BeanSession session) {
956      ObjectSwap<T,?> ps = getSwap(session);
957      return (ps == null ? this : ps.getSwapClassMeta(session));
958   }
959
960   /**
961    * Returns the example of this class.
962    *
963    * @param session
964    *    The bean session.
965    *    <br>Required because the example method may take it in as a parameter.
966    * @param jpSession The JSON parser for parsing examples into POJOs.
967    * @return The serialized class type, or this object if no swap is associated with the class.
968    */
969   @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
970   public T getExample(BeanSession session, JsonParserSession jpSession) {
971      try {
972         if (example != null)
973            return jpSession.parse(example, this);
974         if (exampleMethod != null)
975            return (T)MethodInfo.of(exampleMethod).invokeFuzzy(null, session);
976         if (exampleField != null)
977            return (T)exampleField.get(null);
978
979         if (isCollection()) {
980            Object etExample = getElementType().getExample(session, jpSession);
981            if (etExample != null) {
982               if (canCreateNewInstance()) {
983                  Collection c = (Collection)newInstance();
984                  c.add(etExample);
985                  return (T)c;
986               }
987               return (T)Collections.singleton(etExample);
988            }
989         } else if (isArray()) {
990            Object etExample = getElementType().getExample(session, jpSession);
991            if (etExample != null) {
992               Object o = Array.newInstance(getElementType().innerClass, 1);
993               Array.set(o, 0, etExample);
994               return (T)o;
995            }
996         } else if (isMap()) {
997            Object vtExample = getValueType().getExample(session, jpSession);
998            Object ktExample = getKeyType().getExample(session, jpSession);
999            if (ktExample != null && vtExample != null) {
1000               if (canCreateNewInstance()) {
1001                  Map m = (Map)newInstance();
1002                  m.put(ktExample, vtExample);
1003                  return (T)m;
1004               }
1005               return (T)Collections.singletonMap(ktExample, vtExample);
1006            }
1007         }
1008
1009         return null;
1010      } catch (Exception e) {
1011         throw new ClassMetaRuntimeException(e);
1012      }
1013   }
1014

1016    * For array and {@code Collection} types, returns the class type of the components of the array or
1017    * {@code Collection}.
1018    *
1019    * @return The element class type, or <jk>null</jk> if this class is not an array or Collection.
1020    */
1021   public ClassMeta<?> getElementType() {
1022      return elementType;

1271   /**

1273    *

1275    */
1276   public boolean isInteger() {
1277      return innerClass == Integer.class || innerClass == int.class;
1278   }

1429   public ClassMeta<?>[] getArgs() {
1430      return args;
1431   }
1432
1433   /**
1434    * Returns the argument metadata at the specified index if this is an args metadata object.
1435    *
1436    * @param index The argument index.
1437    * @return The The argument metadata.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
1438    * @throws BeanRuntimeException If this metadata object is not a list of arguments, or the index is out of range.
1439    */
1440   public ClassMeta<?> getArg(int index) {
1441      if (args != null && index >= 0 && index < args.length)
1442         return args[index];
1443      throw new BeanRuntimeException("Invalid argument index specified:  {0}.  Only {1} arguments are defined.", index, args == null ? 0 : args.length);
1444   }

1446   /**
1447    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if instance of this object can be <jk>null</jk>.
1448    *
1449    * <p>
1450    * Objects can be <jk>null</jk>, but primitives cannot, except for chars which can be represented by
1451    * <code>(<jk>char</jk>)0</code>.
1452    *
1453    * @return <jk>true</jk> if instance of this class can be null.
1454    */
1455   public boolean isNullable() {
1456      if (innerClass.isPrimitive())
1457         return cc == CHAR;
1458      return true;
1459   }

1491   /**
1492    * Returns the {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this class that's the best match for the specified session.
1493    *
1494    * @param session
1495    *    The current bean session.
1496    *    <br>If multiple swaps are associated with a class, only the first one with a matching media type will
1497    *    be returned.
1498    * @return
1499    *    The {@link ObjectSwap} associated with this class, or <jk>null</jk> if there are no POJO swaps associated with
1500    *    this class.
1501    */
1502   public ObjectSwap<T,?> getSwap(BeanSession session) {
1503      if (swaps != null) {
1504         int matchQuant = 0, matchIndex = -1;
1505
1506         for (int i = 0; i < swaps.length; i++) {
1507            int q = swaps[i].match(session);
1508            if (q > matchQuant) {
1509               matchQuant = q;
1510               matchIndex = i;
1511            }
1512         }
1513
1514         if (matchIndex > -1)
1515            return swaps[matchIndex];
1516      }
1517      return null;
1518   }
1519
1520   /**
1521    * Returns the builder swap associated with this class.
1522    *
1523    * @param session The current bean session.
1524    * @return The builder swap associated with this class, or <jk>null</jk> if it doesn't exist.
1525    */
1526   public BuilderSwap<T,?> getBuilderSwap(BeanSession session) {
1527      return builderSwap;
1528   }

1571   /**
1572    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1573    *
1574    * @return <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this class can be constructed.
1575    */
1576   public boolean canCreateNewInstance() {
1577      if (isMemberClass)
1578         return false;
1579      if (noArgConstructor != null || getProxyInvocationHandler() != null || (isArray() && elementType.canCreateNewInstance()))
1580         return true;
1581      return false;
1582   }
1583
1584   /**
1585    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1586    * Returns <jk>false</jk> if this is a non-static member class and the outer object does not match the class type of
1587    * the defining class.
1588    *
1589    * @param outer
1590    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1591    * @return
1592    *    <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this class can be created within the context of the specified outer object.
1593    */
1594   public boolean canCreateNewInstance(Object outer) {
1595      if (isMemberClass)
1596         return outer != null && noArgConstructor != null && noArgConstructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass());
1597      return canCreateNewInstance();
1598   }
1599
1600   /**
1601    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class can be instantiated as a bean.
1602    * Returns <jk>false</jk> if this is a non-static member class and the outer object does not match the class type of
1603    * the defining class.
1604    *
1605    * @param outer
1606    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1607    * @return
1608    *    <jk>true</jk> if a new instance of this bean can be created within the context of the specified outer object.
1609    */
1610   public boolean canCreateNewBean(Object outer) {
1611      if (beanMeta == null || beanMeta.constructor == null)
1612         return false;
1613      if (isMemberClass)
1614         return outer != null && beanMeta.constructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass());
1615      return true;
1616   }
1617
1618   /**
1619    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class can call the {@link #newInstanceFromString(Object, String)} method.
1620    *
1621    * @param outer
1622    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.
1623    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1624    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a no-arg constructor or invocation handler.
1625    */
1626   public boolean canCreateNewInstanceFromString(Object outer) {
1627      if (fromStringMethod != null)
1628         return true;
1629      if (stringConstructor != null) {
1630         if (isMemberClass)
1631            return outer != null && stringConstructor.hasParamTypes(outer.getClass(), String.class);
1632         return true;
1633      }
1634      return false;
1635   }

1686   /**
1687    * Returns the default value for primitives such as <jk>int</jk> or <jk>Integer</jk>.
1688    *
1689    * @return The default value, or <jk>null</jk> if this class type is not a primitive.
1690    */
1691   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1692   public T getPrimitiveDefault() {
1693      return (T)primitiveDefault;
1694   }
1695
1696   /**
1697    * If this is an {@link Optional}, returns an empty optional.
1698    *
1699    * <p>
1700    * Note that if this is a nested optional, will recursively create empty optionals.
1701    *
1702    * @return An empty optional, or <jk>null</jk> if this isn't an optional.
1703    */
1704   public Optional<?> getOptionalDefault() {
1705      if (isOptional())
1706         return Utils.opt(getElementType().getOptionalDefault());
1707      return null;
1708   }
1709
1710   /**
1711    * Converts the specified object to a string.
1712    *
1713    * @param t The object to convert.
1714    * @return The object converted to a string, or <jk>null</jk> if the object was null.
1715    */
1716   public String toString(Object t) {
1717      if (t == null)
1718         return null;
1719      if (isEnum() && beanContext.isUseEnumNames())
1720         return ((Enum<?>)t).name();
1721      return t.toString();
1722   }
1723
1724   /**
1725    * Create a new instance of the main class of this declared type from a <c>String</c> input.
1726    *
1727    * <p>
1728    * In order to use this method, the class must have one of the following methods:
1729    * <ul>
1730    *    <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T valueOf(String in);</code>
1731    *    <li><code><jk>public static</jk> T fromString(String in);</code>
1732    *    <li><code><jk>public</jk> T(String in);</code>
1733    * </ul>
1734    *
1735    * @param outer
1736    *    The outer class object for non-static member classes.  Can be <jk>null</jk> for non-member or static classes.
1737    * @param arg The input argument value.
1738    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no string constructor on the object.
1739    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1740    */
1741   @SuppressWarnings({ "unchecked" })
1742   public T newInstanceFromString(Object outer, String arg) throws ExecutableException {
1743
1744      if (isEnum()) {
1745         T t = (T)enumValues.getKey(arg);
1746         if (t == null && ! beanContext.isIgnoreUnknownEnumValues())
1747            throw new ExecutableException("Could not resolve enum value '"+arg+"' on class '"+getInnerClass().getName()+"'");
1748         return t;
1749      }
1750
1751      Method m = fromStringMethod;
1752      if (m != null) {
1753         try {
1754            return (T)m.invoke(null, arg);
1755         } catch (IllegalAccessException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException e) {
1756            throw new ExecutableException(e);
1757         }
1758      }
1759      ConstructorInfo c = stringConstructor;
1760      if (c != null) {
1761         if (isMemberClass)
1762            return c.<T>invoke(outer, arg);
1763         return c.<T>invoke(arg);
1764      }
1765      throw new ExecutableException("No string constructor or valueOf(String) method found for class '"+getInnerClass().getName()+"'");
1766   }
1767
1768   /**
1769    * Create a new instance of the main class of this declared type.
1770    *
1771    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no no-arg constructor on the object.
1772    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1773    */
1774   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
1775   public T newInstance() throws ExecutableException {
1776      if (isArray())
1777         return (T)Array.newInstance(getInnerClass().getComponentType(), 0);
1778      ConstructorInfo c = getConstructor();
1779      if (c != null)
1780         return c.<T>invoke();
1781      InvocationHandler h = getProxyInvocationHandler();
1782      if (h != null)
1783         return (T)Proxy.newProxyInstance(this.getClass().getClassLoader(), new Class[] { getInnerClass(), java.io.Serializable.class }, h);
1784      if (isArray())
1785         return (T)Array.newInstance(this.elementType.innerClass,0);
1786      return null;
1787   }
1788
1789   /**
1790    * Same as {@link #newInstance()} except for instantiating non-static member classes.
1791    *
1792    * @param outer
1793    *    The instance of the owning object of the member class instance.
1794    *    Can be <jk>null</jk> if instantiating a non-member or static class.
1795    * @return A new instance of the object, or <jk>null</jk> if there is no no-arg constructor on the object.
1796    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
1797    */
1798   public T newInstance(Object outer) throws ExecutableException {
1799      if (isMemberClass)
1800         return noArgConstructor.<T>invoke(outer);
1801      return newInstance();
1802   }
1803
1804   /**
1805    * Similar to {@link #equals(Object)} except primitive and Object types that are similar are considered the same.
1806    * (e.g. <jk>boolean</jk> == <c>Boolean</c>).
1807    *
1808    * @param cm The class meta to compare to.
1809    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified class-meta is equivalent to this one.
1810    */
1811   public boolean same(ClassMeta<?> cm) {
1812      if (equals(cm))
1813         return true;
1814      return (isPrimitive() && cc == cm.cc);
1815   }
1816
1817   @Override /* Object */
1818   public String toString() {
1819      return toString(false);
1820   }
1821
1822   /**
1823    * Same as {@link #toString()} except use simple class names.
1824    *
1825    * @param simple Print simple class names only (no package).
1826    * @return A new string.
1827    */
1828   public String toString(boolean simple) {
1829      return toString(new StringBuilder(), simple).toString();
1830   }
1831
1832   /**
1833    * Appends this object as a readable string to the specified string builder.
1834    *
1835    * @param sb The string builder to append this object to.
1836    * @param simple Print simple class names only (no package).
1837    * @return The passed-in string builder.
1838    */
1839   protected StringBuilder toString(StringBuilder sb, boolean simple) {
1840      String n = innerClass.getName();
1841      if (simple) {
1842         int i = n.lastIndexOf('.');
1843         n = n.substring(i == -1 ? 0 : i+1).replace('$', '.');
1844      }
1845      if (cc == ARRAY)
1846         return elementType.toString(sb, simple).append('[').append(']');
1847      if (cc == MAP)
1848         return sb.append(n).append(keyType.isObject() && valueType.isObject() ? "" : "<"+keyType.toString(simple)+","+valueType.toString(simple)+">");
1849      if (cc == BEANMAP)
1850         return sb.append(BeanMap.class.getName()).append('<').append(n).append('>');
1851      if (cc == COLLECTION || cc == OPTIONAL)
1852         return sb.append(n).append(elementType.isObject() ? "" : "<"+elementType.toString(simple)+">");
1853      return sb.append(n);
1854   }
1855
1856   /**
1857    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an instance of this class.
1858    *
1859    * <p>
1860    * This is a simple comparison on the base class itself and not on any generic parameters.
1861    *
1862    * @param o The object to check.
1863    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the specified object is an instance of this class.
1864    */
1865   public boolean isInstance(Object o) {
1866      if (o != null)
1867         return info.isParentOf(o.getClass()) || (isPrimitive() && info.getPrimitiveWrapper() == o.getClass());
1868      return false;
1869   }
1870
1871   /**
1872    * Returns a readable name for this class (e.g. <js>"java.lang.String"</js>, <js>"boolean[]"</js>).
1873    *
1874    * @return The readable name for this class.
1875    */
1876   public String getFullName() {
1877      return info.getFullName();
1878   }

1883    * @return The  name of the inner class.
1884    */
1885   public String getName() {
1886      return innerClass.getName();
1887   }

1889   /**

1891    *
1892    * @return The simple name of the inner class.
1893    */
1894   public String getSimpleName() {
1895      return innerClass.getSimpleName();
1896   }

1898   /**
1899    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from a Reader.
1900    *
1901    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from a Reader.
1902    */
1903   public boolean hasReaderMutater() {
1904      return hasMutaterFrom(Reader.class);
1905   }

1907   /**
1908    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from a Reader.
1909    *
1910    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
1911    */
1912   public Mutater<Reader,T> getReaderMutater() {
1913      return getFromMutater(Reader.class);
1914   }
1915
1916   /**
1917    * Returns <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from an InputStream.
1918    *
1919    * @return <jk>true</jk> if this class has a transform associated with it that allows it to be created from an InputStream.
1920    */
1921   public boolean hasInputStreamMutater() {

2000      Mutater t = getFromMutater(o.getClass());
2001      return (T)(t == null ? null : t.mutate(o));

2030   /**
2031    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from other object types.
2032    *
2033    * @param <I> The transform-from class.
2034    * @param c The transform-from class.
2035    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
2036    */
2037   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
2038   public <I> Mutater<I,T> getFromMutater(Class<I> c) {
2039      Mutater t = fromMutaters.get(c);
2040      if (t == Mutaters.NULL)
2041         return null;
2042      if (t == null) {
2043         t = Mutaters.get(c, innerClass);
2044         if (t == null)
2045            t = Mutaters.NULL;
2046         fromMutaters.put(c, t);
2047      }
2048      return t == Mutaters.NULL ? null : t;
2049   }
2050
2051   /**
2052    * Returns the transform for this class for creating instances from other object types.
2053    *
2054    * @param <O> The transform-to class.
2055    * @param c The transform-from class.
2056    * @return The transform, or <jk>null</jk> if no such transform exists.
2057    */
2058   @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes", "unchecked" })
2059   public <O> Mutater<T,O> getToMutater(Class<O> c) {
2060      Mutater t = toMutaters.get(c);
2061      if (t == Mutaters.NULL)
2062         return null;
2063      if (t == null) {
2064         t = Mutaters.get(innerClass, c);
2065         if (t == null)
2066            t = Mutaters.NULL;
2067         toMutaters.put(c, t);
2068      }
2069      return t == Mutaters.NULL ? null : t;
2070   }

2072   /**
2073    * Shortcut for calling <code>getInnerClass().getAnnotation(a) != <jk>null</jk></code>.
2074    *
2075    * @param a The annotation to check for.
2076    * @return <jk>true</jk> if the inner class has the annotation.
2077    */
2078   public boolean hasAnnotation(Class<? extends Annotation> a) {
2079      return getLastAnnotation(a) != null;
2080   }
2081
2082   /**
2083    * Shortcut for calling <c>getInnerClass().getAnnotation(a)</c>.
2084    *
2085    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2086    * @param a The annotation to retrieve.
2087    * @return The specified annotation, or <jk>null</jk> if the class does not have the specified annotation.
2088    */
2089   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2090   public <A extends Annotation> A getLastAnnotation(Class<A> a) {
2091      Optional<A> o = (Optional<A>)annotationLastMap.get(a);
2092      if (o == null) {
2093         if (beanContext == null)
2094            return info.getAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, a);
2095         o = Utils.opt(info.getAnnotation(beanContext, a));
2096         annotationLastMap.put(a, o);
2097      }
2098      return o.orElse(null);
2099   }
2100
2101   /**
2102    * Performs an action on all matching annotations of the specified type defined on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2103    *
2104    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2105    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2106    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if action should be performed.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2107    * @param action An action to perform on the entry.
2108    * @return This object.
2109    */
2110   public <A extends Annotation> ClassMeta<T> forEachAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter, Consumer<A> action) {
2111      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2112      if (array == null) {
2113         if (beanContext == null)
2114            info.forEachAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter, action);
2115         return this;
2116      }
2117      for (A a : array)
2118         consume(filter, action, a);
2119      return this;
2120   }
2121
2122   /**
2123    * Returns the first matching annotation on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2124    *
2125    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2126    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2127    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2128    * @return This object.
2129    */
2130   public <A extends Annotation> Optional<A> firstAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
2131      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2132      if (array == null) {
2133         if (beanContext == null)
2134            return Optional.ofNullable(info.firstAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter));
2135         return Optional.empty();
2136      }
2137      for (A a : array)
2138         if (test(filter, a))
2139            return Optional.of(a);
2140      return Optional.empty();
2141   }
2142
2143   /**
2144    * Returns the last matching annotation on this class or parent classes/interfaces in parent-to-child order.
2145    *
2146    * @param <A> The annotation type to look for.
2147    * @param type The annotation to search for.
2148    * @param filter A predicate to apply to the entries to determine if annotation should be used.  Can be <jk>null</jk>.
2149    * @return This object.
2150    */
2151   public <A extends Annotation> Optional<A> lastAnnotation(Class<A> type, Predicate<A> filter) {
2152      A[] array = annotationArray(type);
2153      if (array == null) {
2154         if (beanContext == null)
2155            return Optional.ofNullable(info.lastAnnotation(BeanContext.DEFAULT, type, filter));
2156         return Optional.empty();
2157      }
2158      for (int i = array.length-1; i >= 0; i--)
2159         if (test(filter, array[i]))
2160            return Optional.of(array[i]);
2161      return Optional.empty();
2162   }
2163
2164   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2165   private <A extends Annotation> A[] annotationArray(Class<A> type) {
2166      A[] array = (A[])annotationArrayMap.get(type);
2167      if (array == null && beanContext != null) {
2168         List<A> l = list();
2169         info.forEachAnnotation(beanContext, type, x-> true, x -> l.add(x));
2170         array = (A[])Array.newInstance(type, l.size());
2171         for (int i = 0; i < l.size(); i++)
2172            Array.set(array, i, l.get(i));
2173         annotationArrayMap.put(type, array);
2174      }
2175      return array;
2176   }

2178   /**
2179    * Returns a calculated property on this context.
2180    *
2181    * @param <T2> The type to convert the property to.
2182    * @param name The name of the property.
2183    * @param function The function used to create this property.
2184    * @return The property value.  Never <jk>null</jk>.
2185    */
2186   @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
2187   public <T2> Optional<T2> getProperty(String name, Function<ClassMeta<?>,T2> function) {
2188      Optional<T2> t = (Optional<T2>) properties.get(name);
2189      if (t == null) {
2190         t = Utils.opt(function.apply(this));
2191         properties.put(name, t);
2192      }
2193      return t;
2194   }

2203      return this.innerClass.cast(o);

2211   @Override /* Object */
2212   public boolean equals(Object o) {
2213      return (o instanceof ClassMeta) && Utils.eq(this, (ClassMeta<?>)o, (x,y)->Utils.eq(x.innerClass, y.innerClass));
2214   }
